Iron and brass are commonly used in bimetallic thermometers, because

options.text: they have two different coefficients of linear expansion.
they have two different electrical resistances when the temperature changes.

variant.question: A thermocouple can be made of

options.text: two metal conductors of different nature fixed together at two points.
two metal conductors of the same nature fixed together at two points.

which uses two independent thermometers and a comparator to measure an absolute (static) temperature.
which analyses the different expansion of two metals to detect a temperature difference.
which can measure an absolute temperature using the thermoelectric principle.

options.text: based on metallic parts whose expansion/contraction is measured.
capacitors whose capacity varies proportionally with temperature.

variant.question: The airplane outside air temperature 'probe' measures the

options.text: total air temperature minus kinetic heating effects in order to obtain the static temperature.
total air temperature minus compressibility effects in order to obtain the static temperature.
static air temperature minus compressibility effects in order to obtain the total temperature.
static air temperature minus kinetic heating effects in order to obtain the total temperature.

In order to measure temperature the cylinder head temperature (CHT) gauge utilises a:

options.text: thermocouple consisting of two dissimilar metals.

variant.question: The aeroplane outside air temperature probe measures the

options.text: total air temperature, this must be corrected for ram rise and recovery factor to obtain the static air temperature.
static air temperature, this must be corrected for ram rise and recovery factor to obtain the total air temperature.
static air temperature, this must be corrected for compressibility effects to obtain the total air temperature.
total air temperature, this must be corrected for compressibility effects to obtain the static air temperature.

variant.question: The measurement of exhaust gas temperature (EGT) is normally based upon the principle of

options.text: the tension in a helical bimetallic spring.
expansion of a liquid in a capillary.

variant.question: The measurement of SAT (static air temperature) by direct means is not possible on some (fast) aircraft because

options.text: of the effects from adiabatic compression and friction.
most temperature sensors have a low recovery factor.
the boundary layer around the aircraft gets very turbulent.
the airflow causes too much cooling of the sensing probe.
